questions.question: When do post-edit hooks run?
questions.explanation: Post-edit hooks run after Claude has made changes to files, useful for validation or formatting.

questions.question: What's a good use case for pre-commit hooks in Django projects?
questions.explanation: Pre-commit hooks are perfect for running formatters like black and running tests to ensure code quality.

questions.question: Where are hooks configured?
questions.explanation: Hooks are configured in your settings.json file under the hooks section.

questions.question: How can you run different hooks for different file patterns?
questions.explanation: You can use post-edit-pattern to run specific hooks only when certain file patterns are modified.

questions.question: What's a good hook for Django model changes?
questions.explanation: Running makemigrations --check --dry-run helps detect if model changes require new migrations.
